CatDescriptText: Carl Johnson, caseworker, 842 N.Euclid Avenue, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 13, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that the hospital service rendered under Blue Cross plan is worth its present cost to the subscriber? Do you think the rates should be raised?  Why?"  answer reads: "Yes, I think that the hospital service rendered under the Blue Cross plan is worth its present cost to the subscriber.  I have used it many times since I was 18 years of age.  As for the raise in rates, sometimes I think that the hospital's rates are above normal because of high hospital charges."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Carl Johnson wearing light colored suit jacket, dark patterned necktie with decorative clip, and eyeglasses, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
